title: 1967 Japan Soccer League
text:
The 1967 season in <a href="Japan">Japan</a>ese <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a>
League tables.
Promotion/Relegation Series.
Nagoya Mutual Bank promoted, Toyoda Automatic Loom Works relegated.
NHK Cup.
In between the League and the <a href="1967%20Emperor%27s%20Cup">Emperor's Cup</a> (which was played in January 1968 in order to allow for a change of format for the next season), a special match pitting the JSL champions Toyo Industries against All Japan University Soccer Tournament winners <a href="Kansai%20University">Kansai University</a> was played in New Year, 1968. It was a predecessor to the later <a href="Japanese%20Super%20Cup">Japanese Super Cup</a>, which began to be played in <a href="1977%20Japanese%20Super%20Cup">1977</a>, by which time the university teams had ceased to be viable contenders to the <a href="Emperor%27s%20Cup">Emperor's Cup</a>.
